DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : Nutritional intervention weight loss one treatment option obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) patient excess body adiposity . However , effect moderate energy restriction , recommend current guideline treatment obesity , OSA yet know . Objective : To evaluate effect moderate energy restriction body adiposity ; severity OSA ; blood pressure ; sympathetic activity ; oxidative stress ; inflammatory biomarkers ; metabolic profile endothelial function obese patient OSA . Methods : A 16-week randomized clinical trial , involve 21 subject obesity ( grade I II ) , age 20-55 year present apnea/hipopnea index ( AHI ) > 5 events/h . Participants randomize 2 group : 11 energy restriction group ( ERG ) 10 control group ( CG ) . The ERG instruct follow energy-restricted diet ( -800 kcal/day ) CG advise change food intake . At begin end study , participant underwent evaluation : OSA equipment Watch- PAT200® include determination follow parameter OSA severity : AHI , minimum O2 saturation , number O2 desaturations > 4 % ; body adiposity ( weight , % body fat circumference waist , hip neck ) ; blood pressure ( BP ) ; sympathetic nervous system activity ( plasma level catecholamine ) ; inflammatory biomarkers ( c-reactive protein adiponectin ) ; oxidative stress ( malondialdehyde ) ; metabolism glucose ( glucose , insulin HOMA-IR ) lipid ( total cholesterol fraction triglyceride ) ; endothelial function ( index reactive hyperemia evaluate Endo - PAT 2000® cellular adhesion molecule ) . The statistical analysis perform software STATA v. 10 . The level statistical significance p < 0.05 .
